c74object.name: sp.scatter~
c74object.digest: Send incoming audio to mutilple outputs based on onsets
c74object.description: Send incoming audio to mutilple outputs based on onsets.
c74object.discussion: Open the Overview Patch The sp.scatter~ object takes audio input and based on onset analysis sends it to a different channel in a multi-channel output.

inlet.description: Primary input for onset detection and recording. Different input modes can apply filtering based on the type of input being used.
Audio input for recording independently of onset detection when being used in different input modes.

outlet.description: Analyzed onset as a trigger, delay-compensated based on the current delay settings.
Analyzed onset as a gate, delay-compensated based on the current delay settings.

attribute.name: chans
attribute.digest: Sets the number of output channels
attribute.description: Sets the number of output channels in the multi-channel output (requires dsp restart to take effect).

attribute.name: direction
attribute.digest: Direction of step direction
attribute.description: Direction of step direction (forward, reverse, random).

attribute.name: fastrampdown
attribute.digest: The number of samples the relative envelope follower will take to reach the next value when falling
attribute.description: The number of samples the relative envelope follower will take to reach the next value when falling. Typically, this will be faster than slowrampdown.

attribute.name: fastrampup
attribute.digest: The number of samples the relative envelope follower will take to reach the next value when raising
attribute.description: The number of samples the relative envelope follower will take to reach the next value when raising. Typically, this will be faster than slowrampup.

attribute.name: floor
attribute.digest: The level in dB the slow ramp needs to be above to consider a detected difference valid, allowing to ignore the onsets in the noise floor
attribute.description: The level in dB the slow ramp needs to be above to consider a detected difference valid, allowing to ignore the onsets in the noise floor.

attribute.name: highpassfreq
attribute.digest: The frequency of the fourth-order high-pass filter. This is done first on the signal to minimise low frequency intermodulation with very fast ramp lengths.
attribute.description: The frequency of the fourth-order Linkwitzâ€“Riley high-pass filter (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linkwitz%E2%80%93Riley_filter). This is done first on the signal to minimise low frequency intermodulation with very fast ramp lengths. A frequency of 0 bypasses the filter.

attribute.name: input
attribute.digest: Sets the input mode (air microphone, SP Sensor, contact/trigger)
attribute.description: Sets the input mode allowing you to use an air microphone, a Sensory Percussion sensor, or a normal drum trigger/contact mic. When using input modes 3/4, the SP sensor and contact mic are only used for onset detection, and the air microphone will be recorded into the buffer~ for audio analysis. The available options are: 0 = primary input (onset and recording) 1 = SP sensor in primary input (onset and recording) 2 = contact mic in primary input (onset and recording) 3 = SP sensor + air microphone (secondary input) 4 = contact mic + air microphone (secondary input) 5 = SP sensor with mic correction

attribute.name: latency
attribute.digest: Adds a small amount of latency to compensate for onset detection
attribute.description: Adds a small amount of latency to compensate for onset detection time (in samples).

attribute.name: lockout
attribute.digest: Amount of time (in ms) before it can get triggered again
attribute.description: Amount of time (in ms) before an onset can get triggered again.

attribute.name: manual
attribute.digest: Disable internal onset detection
attribute.description: Disable internal onset detection (0 or 1).

attribute.name: metric
attribute.digest: The metric on which spectral difference is computed
attribute.description: The metric used to derive a difference curve between spectral frames. It can be any of the following: 0 = '0' Energy thresholds on (sum of squares of magnitudes / nBins) (like Onsets power) 1 = '1' HFC thresholds on (sum of (squared magnitudes * binNum) / nBins) 2 = '2' SpectralFlux thresholds on (difference in magnitude between consecutive frames, half rectified) 3 = '3' MKL thresholds on (sum of log of magnitude ratio per bin) (or equivalently, sum of difference of the log magnitude per bin) (like Onsets mkl) 4 = '4' IS (WILL PROBABLY BE REMOVED) Itakura - Saito divergence (see literature) 5 = '5' Cosine thresholds on (cosine distance between comparison frames) 6 = '6' PhaseDev takes the past 2 frames, projects to the current, as anticipated if it was a steady state, then compute the sum of the differences, on which it thresholds (like Onsets phase) 7 = '7' WPhaseDev same as PhaseDev, but weighted by the magnitude in order to remove chaos noise floor (like Onsets wphase) 8 = '8' ComplexDev same as PhaseDev, but in the complex domain - the anticipated amp is considered steady, and the phase is projected, then a complex subtraction is done with the actual present frame. The sum of magnitudes is used to threshold (like Onsets complex) 9 = '9' RComplexDev same as above, but rectified (like Onsets rcomplex)

attribute.name: minslicelength
attribute.digest: The length in samples that the slice will stay ON
attribute.description: The length in samples that the Slice will stay ON. Changes of states during that period will be ignored. This is the equivalent of lockout but set in samples.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.digest: Select between amplitude or spectral onset detection algorithms
attribute.description: Select between amplitude or spectral onset detection algorithms.

attribute.name: offthreshold
attribute.digest: The threshold in dB of the relative envelope follower to reset, aka to allow the differential envelope to trigger again.
attribute.description: The threshold in dB of the relative envelope follower to reset, aka to allow the differential envelope to trigger again.

attribute.name: onthreshold
attribute.digest: The threshold in dB of the relative envelope follower to trigger an onset, aka to go ON when in OFF state
attribute.description: The threshold in dB of the relative envelope follower to trigger an onset, aka to go ON when in OFF state. It is computed on the difference between the two envelope followers.

attribute.name: ramp
attribute.digest: Amount of fade time when changing to different channels
attribute.description: Amount of fade time when changing between output channels.

attribute.name: sensitivity
attribute.digest: The nervousness of the algorithm thresholds (from 0 to 100%)
attribute.description: The nervousness of the algorithm thresholds (from 0 to 100%). This is essentially a 'macro' parameter for the individual on/off thresholds.

attribute.name: sequence
attribute.digest: Optional sequence that the scatter will step through
attribute.description: Optional sequence that the scatter will step through. A message of "sequence reset" will return the sequence to its default state.

attribute.name: slowrampdown
attribute.digest: The number of samples the absolute envelope follower will take to reach the next value when falling.
attribute.description: The number of samples the absolute envelope follower will take to reach the next value when falling.

attribute.name: slowrampup
attribute.digest: The number of samples the absolute envelope follower will take to reach the next value when raising.
attribute.description: The number of samples the absolute envelope follower will take to reach the next value when raising.

attribute.name: smoothing
attribute.digest: The size of the smoothing filter applied to the difference curve
attribute.description: The size of the smoothing filter applied to the difference curve when in spectral mode.

attribute.name: window
attribute.digest: Window of time to look for spectral difference in (for HFC, SpectralFlux, MKL, Cosine only)
attribute.description: Window of time to look for spectral difference in when in spectral mode (for HFC, SpectralFlux, MKL, Cosine only). (in ms)
